coded_answer.p: I'm writing just for theone reason, to inform you how bad became the present production is, namecalled "OVER THE RAINBOW".

First of all, in the describingdescription of the show, the starringstar sould bewas Mr. DANNY BROOK, and it wasn't. Another thing was the started time of the performance,; the show started forty fiveforty-five minutes late.

So try to imagine my situation,. I had paiedpaid a lot of money and I couldn'tdidn't sawsee a good show,. I am really disappointed. When the play, "over the Rainbow", finished I tried to eat something, but the fact was that the theatre restaurant was closed, because your personalpersonnel were cleaning all the troublesmess that aan old dog didmade.

But, the principal reason offor this letter is to ask for some money back. I think that couldwould be the best for everyone, and I'llI'd like to give you ansome advice,; if somebody paypays you for a ticket, try to give the best you can.
UnfortunatetyUnfortunately, Pat wasn't very good at keeping secrets. So, I'm going to tell you about my grandfather and his friend Pat:

Many years ago, more or less seventy years ago a young man, with aan exellentexcellent capacity offor thinking and to inventinventing materials things, started building a big thing called a "time machine". He worked day and night.
Every day after having dinner Pat, his best friend, and my grandpa met to talk about their problems, but my Grandpa never told Pat about his new project.
One month later, his workedwork was complete, but he was afraid of testingto test his machine, so he called Pat and spoke to him about it.
The only thing Pat shouldhad doto do, was to choose a date, the one he likesliked, and to press the starter bottonbutton, and you know, what,? heHe did it! The machine worked really goodwell.
The fact was that Pat choosechose to go to the year 2000, and when he arrived, he told every oneeveryone that he was the inventor. That's why Pat wasn't very good at keeping secrets.
